org.dmd.dmr.server.base.extended
Class HierarchicObject

java.lang.Object
  org.dmd.dmc.DmcContainer
      org.dmd.dmw.DmwWrapper
          org.dmd.dmw.DmwNamedObjectWrapper
              org.dmd.dmr.server.base.generated.dmw.HierarchicObjectDMW
                  org.dmd.dmr.server.base.extended.HierarchicObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<HierarchicObject>, DmcContainerIF, DmcNamedObjectIF
Direct Known Subclasses:
DotNamedObjectDMW, LDAPHierarchicObjectDMW
public class HierarchicObject
extends HierarchicObjectDMW
implements java.lang.Comparable<HierarchicObject>

The extended HierarchicObject class provides a variety of functionality that makes using hierarchic objects convenient.

Constructor Summary
HierarchicObject()
          This constructor is used to create a "root" object that has no data and acts merely as the root of a tree of objects.

Constructor Detail

HierarchicObject

public HierarchicObject()
This constructor is used to create a "root" object that has no data and acts merely as the root of a tree of objects.

Method Detail

getSubComps

public java.util.Iterator<HierarchicObject> getSubComps()
Returns:
an iterator over a COPY of the subcomps vector.

setSort

public static void setSort(boolean f)
Sets the global flag that indicates whether or not we sort our subcomponents by their FQN or not.

Parameters:
f - True to sort and false to leave the subcomps in the order they are added.

setParentObject

public void setParentObject(HierarchicObject p)
                     throws ResultException,
                            DmcValueException
This method sets the parent object for this object and reconstructs the FQN as appropriate.

Parameters:
p - the parent object.
Throws:
ResultException - if there's no value for the naming attribute.
DmcValueException

setParentObject

public void setParentObject(HierarchicObject p,
                            boolean buildFQN)
                     throws ResultException,
                            DmcValueException
This method sets the parent object for this object and reconstructs the FQN as appropriate. Set the buildFQN flag to false if the object already has its FQNs set e.g. when it has been retrieved from the repository.

Parameters:
p - the parent object.
buildFQN - Indicates if we need to reset this object's FQNs based on the parent.
Throws:
ResultException - if there's no value for the naming attribute.
DmcValueException

resetParent

public void resetParent(HierarchicObject newParent)
                 throws ResultException,
                        DmcValueException
This method rehomes a branch of hierarchic objects to sit beneath the specified parent. The method recurses through the entire subtree and renames the objects based on the new parent.

Parameters:
newParent -
Throws:
DmcValueException
ResultException

getParentObject

public HierarchicObject getParentObject()

size

public int size()
Returns the number of sub components.

Returns:
The number of subcomponents.

get

public HierarchicObject get(int i)
Returns the subcomp at the specified index or null if there are no subcomps or if the index is out of bounds.

Parameters:
i - Index of the desired subcomp.

removeSubcomponents

public void removeSubcomponents()
This method removes all entries in our subcomponents Vector. Note it doesn't do anything beyond that - the subcomponents are not deleted or affected in any way.

                        throws ResultException,

compareTo

public int compareTo(HierarchicObject o)
Implementation of the Comparable interface so that we can sort our children easily.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<HierarchicObject>

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
We're overloading this to facilitate the way our JSON implementation will work. When objects are referenced (e.g. in a GetResponse) we'll using the FQN as the object name.

Returns:
String

saveToFile

public void saveToFile(java.io.BufferedWriter out,
                       int padding)
                throws java.io.IOException
This method will save an entire hierarchy of objects to the file attached to the specified writer.

Parameters:
out - Writer to the file you want to save in.
padding - The padding to be used when formatting the object..
Throws:
java.io.IOException

saveToFile

public void saveToFile(java.io.BufferedWriter out,
                       int padding,
                       boolean persistentOnly)
                throws java.io.IOException
This method will save an entire hierarchy of objects to the file attached to the specified writer.

Parameters:
out - Writer to the file you want to save in.
padding - The padding to be used when formatting the object..
persistentOnly - If true, only persistent objects will be saved. We stop recursing down a branch when we hit a TRANSIENT object.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

saveToBuffer

public void saveToBuffer(java.lang.StringBuffer sb,
                         int padding)
This method saves the entire hierarchy from this point to the string buffer.

Parameters:
sb - The buffer to which we append the object.
padding - The padding to be used when formatting the object.

saveToBuffer

public void saveToBuffer(java.lang.StringBuffer sb,
                         int padding,
                         boolean persistentOnly)
This method saves the entire hierarchy from this point to the string buffer.

Parameters:
sb - The buffer to which we append the object.
padding - The padding to be used when formatting the object.
persistentOnly - If true, only persistent objects will be saved. We stop recursing down a branch when we hit a TRANSIENT object.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
If the object is a HierarchicObject and has the same FQN as this object, they're equal.

Specified by:
equals in interface DmcNamedObjectIF
Overrides:
equals in class HierarchicObjectDMW
Parameters:
obj - The comparison object.
Returns:
True if the names match.
